page.title: 06PLAYGROUP
page.content: Shirwell, although only a small community, is able to boast that it has a playgroup. This, in common with many other activities in the district, is held at the Village Hall. It is organised by ladies who live in Shirwell but draws its children from as far afield as Loxhore and other villages out towards the parish boundary with Bratton Fleming. The playgroup is held on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 10.00 to 12.00 a.m. with a break for milk and biscuits half way through. Some, although not all of the pupils transfer to Shirwell School for the term in which they become 5 years of age. The school is doing its best to encourage more children to move from the playgroup to the local Primary when they are of age but faces an uphill battle against larger schools.
